description.narrative: Det övergripande målet med det föreslagna programmet är att stimulera socioekonomisk utveckling och levnadsvillkoren för fattigdom i landsbygdsområden i Liberia genom att öka tillgången till el baserade på förnybara energikällor genom att engagera den privata sektorn att saminvestera i byggande, drift och expansion av eltjänster i distributionsnäten i sydöstra Liberia.

The overarching objective of the proposed programme is to stimulate socio-economic development and the living conditions of people living in poverty in rural areas of Liberia by increasing access to electricity based on renewable energy sources by engaging the private sector to co-invest in building, operating and expanding electricity services in the distribution networks in the South East of Liberia. The programme will be complemented by two supporting measures, investing in access roads and in continued support to the reform process with the aim of ensuring an enabling regulatory environment. Ensuring physical access by road is expected to increase interest for participation from prospective electricity service providers as roads will lower the investment costs for building and maintaining renewable energy power plants and distribution grids compared to air-lifting equipment; and as roads also play a role in stimulating economic growth and poverty reduction, enabling goods and services to be brought to market and thereby also playing a key role in enabling growth in electricity demand, making the investments more viable. This is especially important in isolated grids where there are few options to sell surplus power outside the geographical boundaries of the mini-grid.
This specific contribution relates to the supporting measure in auxilliary roads and the specific objective is to procure a consultant for formulation of implementation of a strategy and monitoring framework for the Swedish financial support to the increased access to the South-East of Liberia. The consultant will facilitate the design and formulation together with the Ministry for Public Works (MPW) and produce a project document that is in line with Swedish development cooperation policies.

description.narrative: Hifab International AB was procured according to LOU and has developed a program implementation strategy and monitoring framework for Swedish financial support to increased access to south-east Liberia. The program document considers the current policy context/priority of the Government of Liberia regarding improving access to feeder roads as well as construction of new feeder roads. More importantly, the program document draws synergy between recently completed road projects in other parts of Liberia with those that are currently ongoing, especially those supported with Swedish financial support. The program document also includes a dedicated section on program implementation strategy and the roles of key project stakeholders – eg. The EU, MPW and Sida. A suggested sustainability strategy as well as highlights of cross-cutting issues such as environment, and gender are also highlighted.
No indicator available - only a description of the activity results is published
